Brunno Silva wrote:
> I had some problems when I started to use JUnit, a
> week ago. 
Welcome!
> After some research, I figure out that the
> problem was the J2ME sandbox. I created my first test
> case to test a simple class used by a MIDlet, and it
> didn't work because it's not possible to do something
> like that:
>
> public static void main (String args[])
> {
>        The J2ME code...
> }
Sounds frustrating.  I'm afraid I don't know a lot about J2ME, but I 
know a fair bit about running JUnit.  If J2ME doesn't run code within a 
"main" method, can you give a short example of how J2ME code running 
inside a sandbox looks?  Thanks,

    David Saff
